channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-196] remove ant.jar from lib directory
item.description: We don't need the lib/jetty-ext/ant.jar and it causes problems if it disagrees with the version of ant that people are using.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Removal of the Ant jar causes the problems described in HADOOP-1735

I ran a couple of tests (with and without) the ant jar in lib/jetty-ext This comment shows the behavior WITHOUT ant.jar present. The next comment will show the behavior WITH ant.jar present.

bash-3.1$ ls -l lib/jetty-ext/ant.jar
ls: lib/jetty-ext/ant.jar: No such file or directory
bash-3.1$ ant javadoc
Buildfile: build.xml

Sorry about not realizing the problem I was creating. I still think it is worth removing the ant.jar from our build, since pretty much by definition it is on the class path of the invoking ant. I'm not sure how, but it is on the classpath for javac, but not javadoc. Does anyone know ant details well enough that this is obvious?

I think javadoc is run in a child process, and does not inherit the parent's classpath. So we need to add ant's jars explicitly to the javadoc classpath. Perhaps this can be simply done by adding the system property java.class.path?

+1 on Doug's patch.

Mine works but is not as elegant.
I just committed your patch. Thanks, Doug.

-1, build or testing failed

2 attempts failed to build and test the latest attachment http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12364161/HADOOP-1726.patch against trunk revision r567308.

Please note that this message is automatically generated and may represent a problem with the automation system and not the patch.
Note that the unit test failure was in HBase...
There will be a fix for the timeouts in the patch for HADOOP-1723
The build failures encountered by the patch build for this issue were resolved by HADOOP-1723
